reference.title: Device Screen Capture view
reference.shortdesc: The Device Screen Capture view presents a snapshot of a real or emulated device screen. From this dialog you can save the image as a PNG file or copy it to the clipboard. From this dialog you can also capture additional screen images from the selected device.

section.p: The Device Screen Capture view appears when you right-click a device in the Device Management view (either a connected device listed under Android Handset or an emulated device listed under Android Virtual Device) and select Take Screenshot. Note that the captured screen isn't automatically saved or copied to the clipboard; you need to use the Save or Copy buttons to preserve the image.

strow.stentry: Recaptures the device screen. By manipulating the device and clicking Refresh, you can easily capture a series of screen images.
Rotates the captured image 90 degrees counterclockwise. Successive clicks of the Rotate button continue to rotate the image; two clicks turn the image upside down, for instance.
Saves the image as a PNG file in a location you specify.
Copies the image to the computer's clipboard.
Closes the Device Screen Capture dialog. Note that if you haven't saved the image or copied it to the clipboard, the image won't be preserved.
